org.openimaj.image.analysis.algorithm.histogram

Class SATWindowedExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.analysis.algorithm.histogram.SATWindowedExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WindowedHistogramExtractor
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GradientOrientationHistogramExtractor

    public class SATWindowedExtractor
extends Object
implements WindowedHistogramExtractor
    This class implements a WindowedHistogramExtractor with the primary purpose of of producing efficient access to histograms of arbitrary windows of the image.

    This implementation is based on a stack of SummedAreaTables, with one SummedAreaTable per histogram bin. Obviously this is quite memory intensive, so should probably only be used with small numbers of bins. However, the advantage over a BinnedWindowedExtractor is that the histogram extraction is an O(1) operation, and it is thus very quick for evaluating many windows.

    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

      • SATWindowedExtractor

        Parameters:

      • SATWindowedExtractor

        public SATWindowedExtractor(FImage[] magnitudeMaps)
        Construct with the given spatial histogram magnitude maps. Each image represents a bin of the histogram, and each element is the histogram weight at the respective spatial location for the corresponding bin (usually the images will be very sparse).
        Parameters:
        magnitudeMaps - array of images, one per bin, with each pixel set to the histogram magnitude at that bin
